text:
Hi Team,
We have an Enterprise Customer Platform for HubSpot, but I’m unable to retrieve the permissions assigned to a user. For example, in the attached screenshot, I’ve highlighted one user and specified their permissions as follows:
• *View:* All companies
• *Edit:* Their team’s companies
• *Delete:* None
I’d like to retrieve these permissions via the API. Is there a way to accomplish this?

we are using <https://developers.HubSpot.com/beta-docs/reference/api/settings/users/user-provisioning#get-%2Fsettings%2Fv3%2Fusers%2Froles> for our reference but we got no necessary details.

Hi Zach!

I think there must be a different workflow ID which is internal that I cannot access without using the API, as the ID from the URL does not work with this endpoint: <https://api.hubapi.com/automation/v2/workflows/:workflowId/enrollments/contacts/:email>

Perhaps because it's an older version, but I could not find a newer version of this endpoint of enrolling a contact into a workflow.

Infact, just figured out the difference.
Workflow ID = internal reference (only accessed via API)
Flow ID = visible within the URL

Hello, I’m trying to create a custom subscription preferences page, and am able to pull a list of preferences for a specific contact via the <https://developers.HubSpot.com/beta-docs/guides/api/marketing/subscriptions#subscriptions-v4-api|Subscriptions v4 API>

However the response does not include the ‘visibility rules’ from /settings/{PORTAL_ID}/marketing/email/types that determine which contacts should see a subscription types on their preference pages.

Is there a way to pull these visibility rules via API or is the only way to use these with the @HubSpot/email_subscriptions module ?

Hi, guys! How do I make an API call for a custom object, with the goal of retrieving all deals associated with that object? I don’t want an API call for the object itself, but rather for the record of this object; they are different things, and I’m only getting the first one.
What is this "Object Type" in the URL? The URL of my custom object is as follows:
